quiz_initialize_variable.Name: quiz_initialize_variable
quiz_initialize_variable.Description: How to initialize a global variable
quiz_initialize_variable.QuestionHTML: Define (initialize) a global variable named <font color="red"> $#STR1#$</font> and give it an initial value of <font color="red">-91.9</font>.
Hints: You will need an initialize block from the Variables drawer.
You will also need a number block from the Math drawer.
Pseudocode: Initialize global $#STR1#$ to -91.9
quiz_initialize_variable.Xmlsolution: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="87" y="27"><title name="NAME">$#STR1#$</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">-91.9</title></block></value></block></xml>

quiz_statements.Name: quiz_statements
quiz_statements.QuestionHTML: Write a setter statement that adds 1 to the global variable Z.
Hints: The setter block is in the Variables drawer.
You will also need a getter block in the Variables drawer.
Create an expression block for Z + 1 and plug it into the set global Z block.
Pseudocode: Set Z to Z + 1
quiz_statements.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="53" y="3"><title name="NAME">Z</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">1</title></block></value></block></xml>
quiz_statements.Xmlsolution: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="53" y="3"><title name="NAME">Z</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">1</title></block></value></block><block type="lexical_variable_set" inline="false" x="56" y="48"><title name="VAR">global Z</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_add" inline="true"><mutation items="2"></mutation><value name="NUM0"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global Z</title></block></value><value name="NUM1"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">1</title></block></value></block></value></block></xml>

quiz_incrementing.Name: quiz_incrementing
quiz_incrementing.DisplayName: Statements: Add a number to a Global
quiz_incrementing.Description: How to add a number to a global variable
quiz_incrementing.QuestionHTML: Use a setter to increment global Z by -91.9.
Hints: The setter block is in the Variables drawer.
You will also need a getter block in the Variables drawer.
Create an expression block for Z + -91.9 and plug it into the set global Z block.
Pseudocode: Set Z to Z + -91.9
quiz_incrementing.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="1" y="-1"><title name="NAME">Z</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">10</title></block></value></block></xml>

quiz_double_variable.Name: quiz_double_variable
quiz_double_variable.Description: How to double a global variable.
quiz_double_variable.QuestionHTML: Construct a block to double the value of $#STR1#$, which has initial value -91.9.
Hints: You'll need a setter block in the Variables drawer.
You'll need a math block in the Math drawer.
To double a variable, ether multiply it times 2 or add it to itself and assign the result back to the variable using the setter.
Pseudocode: Set $#STR1#$ to $#STR1#$ * 2

quiz_random_number.Name: quiz_random_number
quiz_random_number.QuestionHTML: Assign a random number between -91.9 and -92.9 to the global variable $#STR1#$.
Hints: Use the <font color="red">random_integer_from_to</font> block in the Math drawer.

quiz_initialize.Name: quiz_initialize
quiz_initialize.QuestionHTML: Create a sequence of setter statements that sets the values of all global variables to 0.
Hints: You will need a setter block for each global variable. These are in the Variables drawer.
Each block should just set the global variable's value to 0.

Pseudocode: Set X to 0
Set Y to 0
quiz_initialize.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="40" y="14"><title name="NAME">X</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">10</title></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="44" y="54"><title name="NAME">Y</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">20</title></block></value></block></xml>
quiz_initialize.Xmlsolution: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="40" y="14"><title name="NAME">X</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">10</title></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="44" y="54"><title name="NAME">Y</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">20</title></block></value></block><block type="lexical_variable_set" inline="false" x="76" y="109"><title name="VAR">global X</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">1</title></block></value><next><block type="lexical_variable_set" inline="false"><title name="VAR">global Y</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">1</title></block></value></block></next></block></xml>

Use the multiplication operator in the Math drawer.
You'll also need the getter block in the Variables drawer.

quiz_text_color.Name: quiz_text_color
quiz_text_color.Description: Use a setter block to set a button's Text color property.

Hints: You will need to drag Button1's setter block from the Button drawer to the workspace.

quiz_simple_if_else.Name: quiz_simple_if_else
quiz_simple_if_else.Description: How to conditionally set a variable.
quiz_simple_if_else.QuestionHTML: Construct an if-else statement that adds 1 to the variable X if variable Y is greater than 0 and otherwise subtracts 1.
Hints: Hint #1.
Hint #2.
Hint #3.
quiz_simple_if_else.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="200" y="1"><title name="NAME">X</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="204" y="39"><title name="NAME">Y</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block><block type="controls_if" inline="false" x="212" y="85"><mutation else="1"></mutation></block></xml>
quiz_simple_if_else.Xmlsolution: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="200" y="1"><title name="NAME">X</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="204" y="39"><title name="NAME">Y</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block><block type="controls_if" inline="false" x="202" y="85"><mutation else="1"></mutation><value name="IF0"><block type="math_compare" inline="true"><title name="OP">GT</title><value name="A"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global Y</title></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO0"><block type="lexical_variable_set" inline="false"><title name="VAR">global X</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_add" inline="true"><mutation items="2"></mutation><value name="NUM0"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global X</title></block></value><value name="NUM1"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">1</title></block></value></block></value></block></statement><statement name="ELSE"><block type="lexical_variable_set" inline="false"><title name="VAR">global X</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_subtract" inline="true"><value name="A"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global X</title></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">1</title></block></value></block></value></block></statement></block></xml>

quiz_if_x_greater_than_y.Name: quiz_if_x_greater_than_y
quiz_if_x_greater_than_y.DisplayName: Statements: Use If/Else to Set a Label
quiz_if_x_greater_than_y.QuestionHTML: Construct an if/else block that expresses the following statement: If the variable X is greater than the variable Y, then the word "Greater" should be assigned to Label1. Otherwise "Lesser" should be assigned. (Spelling counts.)
Hints: Values such as "Greater" are Text objects in the Text drawer.
The greater-than block is in the Math drawer.
quiz_if_x_greater_than_y.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="108" y="3"><title name="NAME">X</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">100</title></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="333" y="4"><title name="NAME">Y</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">100</title></block></value></block></xml>
quiz_if_x_greater_than_y.Xmlsolution: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="108" y="3"><title name="NAME">X</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">100</title></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="333" y="4"><title name="NAME">Y</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">100</title></block></value></block><block type="controls_if" inline="false" x="114" y="60"><mutation else="1"></mutation><value name="IF0"><block type="math_compare" inline="true"><title name="OP">GT</title><value name="A"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global X</title></block></value><value name="B"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global Y</title></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO0"><block type="Label1_setproperty" inline="false"><mutation yailtype="text"></mutation><title name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Label1</title><title name="PROP">Text</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="text"><title name="TEXT">Greater</title></block></value></block></statement><statement name="ELSE"><block type="Label1_setproperty" inline="false"><mutation yailtype="text"></mutation><title name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Label1</title><title name="PROP">Text</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="text"><title name="TEXT">Lesser</title></block></value></block></statement></block></xml>

quiz_eval_arithmetic.Name: quiz_eval_arithmetic
quiz_eval_arithmetic.QuestionHTML: Evaluate the expression and type your answer into the text box.
Hints: If the expression is too hard to do in your head, feel free to use a calculator.
To skip the problem, just hit the 'Submit' button. You'll be given the correct answer.
quiz_eval_arithmetic.Xmlgenerator: function xmlGenerator(xml,low, high, op){var ops = ['ADD', 'MINUS', 'MULTIPLY', 'DIVIDE', 'POWER'];var name1=''; var name2=''; var type = '';if (!op){op = ops[Math.floor(Math.random() * ops.length)];if (op == 'ADD'){name1='NUM0'; name2='NUM1'; type = 'math_add';}else if (op == 'MINUS'){name1='A';name2='B';type = 'math_subtract';} else if (op == 'MULTIPLY'){name1='NUM0';name2='NUM1';type = 'math_multiply'; } else if (op == 'DIVIDE') {name1='A';name2='B';type = 'math_division';} else {type = 'math_power';name1='A';name2='B';}}var n1 = Math.floor(Math.random() * 10);var n2 = Math.floor(Math.random() * 10);if (low && high) {n1 = low + Math.floor(Math.random() * (high - low + 1));n2 = low + Math.floor(Math.random() * (high - low + 1));}if (op == 'DIVIDE' && n2 == 0) {n2 = 1;}if (op == 'DIVIDE') {var factor = Math.floor(Math.random() * 5);n1 = n2 * factor;}if (op == 'POWER' && n2 > 3) {n2 = 3;}xml = xml.replace('$type', type);xml = xml.replace('$arg1', n1);xml = xml.replace('$arg2', n2);xml=xml.replace('$name1',name1);xml=xml.replace('$name2',name2);return xml; }
quiz_eval_arithmetic.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="$type" inline="true" x="85" y="100"><value name="$name1"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">$arg1</title></block></value><value name="$name2"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">$arg2</title></block></value></block></xml>

quiz_eval_relations.Name: quiz_eval_relations
quiz_eval_relations.QuestionHTML: Evaluate the expression as true or false and type your answer into the text box.
Hints: You can skip the problem by hitting the 'Submit' button.  The correct answer will be displayed.
quiz_eval_relations.Xmlgenerator: function xmlGenerator(xml, low, high, op) {var ops = ['EQ', 'NEQ', 'LT', 'LTE', 'GT', 'GTE'];   if (!op) { op = ops[Math.floor(Math.random() * ops.length)]; } var n1 = Math.floor(Math.random() * 10); var n2 = Math.floor(Math.random() * 10); if (low && high) { n1 = low + Math.floor(Math.random() * (high - low + 1)); n2 = low + Math.floor(Math.random() * (high - low + 1)); } xml = xml.replace('$OP', op); xml = xml.replace('$N1', n1); xml = xml.replace('$N2', n2); return xml; }
quiz_eval_relations.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="math_compare"><title name="OP" >$OP</title><value name="A"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">$N1</title></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">$N2</title></block></value></block></xml>

quiz_simple_relations_fillin.Name: quiz_simple_relations_fillin
quiz_simple_relations_fillin.Description: Simple binary relational fill in the block questions.
quiz_simple_relations_fillin.QuestionHTML: Complete the expression in any way you wish so that the resulting expression is true.
quiz_simple_relations_fillin.Xmlgenerator: function xmlGenerator(xml, low, high, op) {var ops = ['EQ', 'NEQ', 'LT', 'LTE', 'GT', 'GTE']; if (!op) { op = ops[Math.floor(Math.random() * ops.length)]; } var n1 = Math.floor(Math.random() * 10); var n2 = Math.floor(Math.random() * 10); if (low && high) { n1 = low + Math.floor(Math.random() * (high - low + 1)); n2 = low + Math.floor(Math.random() * (high - low + 1)); } xml = xml.replace('$OP', op); xml = xml.replace('$N1', n1); xml = xml.replace('$N2', n2); return xml; }
quiz_simple_relations_fillin.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="math_compare"><title name="OP">$OP</title><value name="A"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">$N1</title></block></value></block><block type="math_number" x="85" y="55"><title name="NUM">$N2</title></block></xml>

quiz_stop_player_if_playing.Name: quiz_stop_player_if_playing
quiz_stop_player_if_playing.Description: Simple if-else to start and stop the Player
quiz_stop_player_if_playing.QuestionHTML: Complete this Button.Click event handler so that it will stop the Player if it is already playing. Otherwise it will start the Player.
Hints: You'll need the appropriate purple blocks from the Player drawer.
Think about what action to "do" when the Player is playing.
Think about what action to "do" when the Player is not playing.
quiz_stop_player_if_playing.Xmltemplate: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><block type="Button1_Click" x="133" y="15"><title name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Button1</title><statement name="DO"><block type="controls_if" inline="false"><mutation else="1"></mutation><value name="IF0"><block type="Player1_getproperty"><mutation yailtype="boolean"></mutation><title name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Player1</title><title name="PROP">IsPlaying</title></block></value></block></statement></block></xml>
quiz_stop_player_if_playing.Xmlsolution: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><block type="Button1_Click" x="132" y="26"><title name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Button1</title><statement name="DO"><block type="controls_if" inline="false"><mutation else="1"></mutation><value name="IF0"><block type="Player1_getproperty"><mutation yailtype="boolean"></mutation><title name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Player1</title><title name="PROP">IsPlaying</title></block></value><statement name="DO0"><block type="Player1_Stop"><title name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Player1</title></block></statement><statement name="ELSE"><block type="Player1_Start"><title name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Player1</title></block></statement></block></statement></block></xml>

quiz_if_else_stop_start_player.Name: quiz_if_else_stop_start_player
quiz_if_else_stop_start_player.DisplayName: Control: If Else Stop Start Player
quiz_if_else_stop_start_player.Description: Construct an if/else block to start and stop the Player depending on whether it's already playing
quiz_if_else_stop_start_player.QuestionHTML: Complete the Button1.Click event. It should pause the Player if it is already playing. Otherwise it should start the Player.
Hints: You'll need an if block in the Control drawer.
Use the mutator on the if block to add an else slot.
Use the drop-down widget on the Player1.isLooping block to select the Player1.isPlaying property.
You'll need the appropriate purple blocks from the Player drawer.
quiz_if_else_stop_start_player.Xmlsolution: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><block type="Button1_Click" x="122" y="32"><title name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Button1</title><statement name="DO"><block type="controls_if" inline="false"><mutation else="1"></mutation><value name="IF0"><block type="Player1_getproperty"><mutation yailtype="boolean"></mutation><title name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Player1</title><title name="PROP">IsPlaying</title></block></value><statement name="DO0"><block type="Player1_Pause"><title name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Player1</title></block></statement><statement name="ELSE"><block type="Player1_Start"><title name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Player1</title></block></statement></block></statement></block></xml>

quiz_proc_two_params.Description: Define a procedure with two parameters.

quiz_proc_call_sum.Name: quiz_proc_call_sum
quiz_proc_call_sum.DisplayName: Procedures: Define a Procedure that Calls a Procedure
quiz_proc_call_sum.Description: Define a procedure that calls a function
quiz_proc_call_sum.QuestionHTML: Given the function sum and global variables X, Y, and Z, define a procedure named add that calls sum to compute the sum of X and Y and assigns the result to Z.
quiz_proc_call_sum.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="procedures_defreturn" inline="false" x="292" y="-8"><mutation><arg name="a"></arg><arg name="b"></arg></mutation><title name="NAME">sum</title><value name="RETURN"><block type="math_add" inline="true"><mutation items="2"></mutation><value name="NUM0"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">a</title></block></value><value name="NUM1"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">b</title></block></value></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="1" y="-1"><title name="NAME">X</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">1</title></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="16" y="29"><title name="NAME">Y</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">1</title></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="31" y="59"><title name="NAME">Z</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block></xml>
quiz_proc_call_sum.Xmlsolution: <xml><block type="procedures_defreturn" inline="false" x="292" y="-8"><mutation><arg name="a"></arg><arg name="b"></arg></mutation><title name="NAME">sum</title><value name="RETURN"><block type="math_add" inline="true"><mutation items="2"></mutation><value name="NUM0"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">a</title></block></value><value name="NUM1"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">b</title></block></value></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="1" y="-1"><title name="NAME">X</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">1</title></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="16" y="29"><title name="NAME">Y</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">1</title></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="31" y="59"><title name="NAME">Z</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block><block type="procedures_defnoreturn" x="278" y="96"><mutation></mutation><title name="NAME">add</title><statement name="STACK"><block type="lexical_variable_set" inline="false"><title name="VAR">global Z</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="procedures_callreturn" inline="false"><mutation name="sum"><arg name="a"></arg><arg name="b"></arg></mutation><title name="PROCNAME">sum</title><value name="ARG0"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global X</title></block></value><value name="ARG1"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global Y</title></block></value></block></value></block></statement></block></xml>

quiz_procedure_bug.Name: quiz_procedure_bug
quiz_procedure_bug.DisplayName: Procedures: Fix a Bug in updateScore() Procedure
quiz_procedure_bug.Description: Fix the bug in the procedure.
quiz_procedure_bug.QuestionHTML: The updateScore procedure contains a bug. It's supposed to calculate the hit rate and then display the hit rate in Label1. Find and fix the bug.
Hints: Think about the order of the statements.
quiz_procedure_bug.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="40" y="-3"><title name="NAME">hitRate</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="39" y="33"><title name="NAME">hits</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="39" y="68"><title name="NAME">misses</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block><block type="procedures_defnoreturn" x="40" y="105"><mutation></mutation><title name="NAME">calculateHitRate</title><statement name="STACK"><block type="lexical_variable_set" inline="false"><title name="VAR">global hitRate</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_division" inline="true"><value name="A"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global hits</title></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_add" inline="true"><mutation items="2"></mutation><value name="NUM0"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global hits</title></block></value><value name="NUM1"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global misses</title></block></value></block></value></block></value></block></statement></block><block type="procedures_defnoreturn" x="42" y="201"><mutation></mutation><title name="NAME">updateScore</title><statement name="STACK"><block type="Label1_setproperty" inline="false"><mutation yailtype="text"></mutation><title name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Label1</title><title name="PROP">Text</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global hitRate</title></block></value><next><block type="procedures_callnoreturn"><mutation name="calculateHitRate"></mutation><title name="PROCNAME">calculateHitRate</title></block></next></block></statement></block></xml>
quiz_procedure_bug.Xmlsolution: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="40" y="-3"><title name="NAME">hitRate</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="39" y="33"><title name="NAME">hits</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="39" y="68"><title name="NAME">misses</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block><block type="procedures_defnoreturn" x="40" y="105"><mutation></mutation><title name="NAME">calculateHitRate</title><statement name="STACK"><block type="lexical_variable_set" inline="false"><title name="VAR">global hitRate</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_division" inline="true"><value name="A"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global hits</title></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_add" inline="true"><mutation items="2"></mutation><value name="NUM0"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global hits</title></block></value><value name="NUM1"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global misses</title></block></value></block></value></block></value></block></statement></block><block type="procedures_defnoreturn" x="42" y="201"><mutation></mutation><title name="NAME">updateScore</title><statement name="STACK"><block type="procedures_callnoreturn"><mutation name="calculateHitRate"></mutation><title name="PROCNAME">calculateHitRate</title><next><block type="Label1_setproperty" inline="false"><mutation yailtype="text"></mutation><title name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Label1</title><title name="PROP">Text</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global hitRate</title></block></value></block></next></block></statement></block></xml>

quiz_calculate_hit_rate.Name: quiz_calculate_hit_rate
quiz_calculate_hit_rate.DisplayName: Procedures: Define Procedure to Calculate Hit Rate
quiz_calculate_hit_rate.QuestionHTML: Using the pre-defined global variables, define a procedure named calculateHitRate that calculates the player's hit percentage, which is defined as: hitRate = hits / (hits + misses).
Hints: You'll need the procedure do block in the Procedures drawer.
Your procedure should set the value of the global hitRate variable.
Build your math expression using blocks in the Math drawer
quiz_calculate_hit_rate.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="63" y="-9"><title name="NAME">hits</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="61" y="29"><title name="NAME">misses</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="65" y="76"><title name="NAME">hitRate</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block></xml>
quiz_calculate_hit_rate.Xmlsolution: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="63" y="-9"><title name="NAME">hits</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="64" y="28"><title name="NAME">misses</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="62" y="72"><title name="NAME">hitRate</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block><block type="procedures_defnoreturn" x="62" y="118"><mutation></mutation><title name="NAME">calculateHitRate</title><statement name="STACK"><block type="lexical_variable_set" inline="false"><title name="VAR">global hitRate</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_division" inline="true"><value name="A"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global hits</title></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_add" inline="true"><mutation items="2"></mutation><value name="NUM0"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global hits</title></block></value><value name="NUM1"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global misses</title></block></value></block></value></block></value></block></statement></block></xml>

quiz_reset_score.Name: quiz_reset_score
quiz_reset_score.DisplayName: Procedures: Define resetScore() to Set Score to 0
quiz_reset_score.Description: Given a global variable, score, define a procedure, resetScore() that sets the global to 0.
quiz_reset_score.QuestionHTML: Define a procedure named <font color="red">resetScore</font> that sets the global variable <font color="red">score</font> to 0.
Hints: The procedure definition block is in the Procedures drawer.
You will need to use a Setter block in the Variables drawer.
quiz_reset_score.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="74" y="6"><title name="NAME">score</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block></xml>
quiz_reset_score.Xmlsolution: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="74" y="6"><title name="NAME">score</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block><block type="procedures_defnoreturn" x="75" y="51"><mutation></mutation><title name="NAME">score</title><statement name="STACK"><block type="lexical_variable_set" inline="false"><title name="VAR">global score</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block></statement></block></xml>

quiz_hello_purr.Name: quiz_hello_purr
quiz_hello_purr.DisplayName: Event Handler: When Button Click Vibrate
quiz_hello_purr.Description: Add a Sound.Vibrate block to the Button.Click procedure.
quiz_hello_purr.QuestionHTML: Update the blocks shown here so that when the button is clicked, the phone vibrates for 500 milliseconds (ms) after the sound is played.
Hints: Look in the 'Sound' drawer for the Sound.Vibrate block.
You'll need a Number block from the Math drawer.
The open slot in the Sound.Vibrate block represents the duration of the vibration in milliseconds (thousandths of a second).
quiz_hello_purr.Xmlsolution: <xml><block type="Button1_Click" x="124" y="6"><title name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Button1</title><statement name="DO"><block type="Sound1_Play"><title name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Sound1</title><next><block type="Sound1_Vibrate" inline="false"><title name="COMPONENT_SELECTOR">Sound1</title><value name="ARG0"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">500</title></block></value></block></next></block></statement></block></xml>

quiz_canvas_touched.Name: quiz_canvas_touched
quiz_canvas_touched.DisplayName: Event Handler: When Canvas Touched Set a Variable
quiz_canvas_touched.Description: Perform a procedure when the Canvas is touched.
quiz_canvas_touched.QuestionHTML: When the Canvas is touched, set the Canvas Height to the value of global variable X.
Hints: You'll need a CanvasTouched event handler for this problem.
The setter for Canvas Height is in the Canvas drawer.
quiz_canvas_touched.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="global_declaration" inline="false" x="83" y="4"><title name="NAME">X</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">400</title></block></value></block></xml>

quiz_increment_variable.Name: quiz_increment_variable
quiz_increment_variable.DisplayName: Event Handler: When Button Clicked Increment Variable
quiz_increment_variable.Description: Ask the user to code a variable increment operation when a Button is clicked.
quiz_increment_variable.QuestionHTML: Complete the block so that it adds 1 to the variable 'X' when Button1 is clicked.
Hints: Blocks for setting and getting variable values are in the 'Variables' drawer.
You'll need to do an addition operation.
Pseudocode: Set X to (get X) + 1
quiz_increment_variable.Xmltemplate: <xml><block type="Button1_Click" x="85" y="100"></block><block type="global_declaration" inline="false"  x="85" y="50"><title name="NAME">X</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block></xml>
quiz_increment_variable.Xmlsolution: <block type="Button1_Click" x="291" y="45"><statement name="DO"><block type="lexical_variable_set" inline="false"><title name="VAR">global X</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_add" inline="true"><mutation items="2"></mutation><value name="NUM0"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">global X</title></block></value><value name="NUM1"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">1</title></block></value></block></value></block></statement></block>

quiz_pause_the_player.Name: quiz_pause_the_player
quiz_pause_the_player.Description: Pause the Player component when the button is clicked
quiz_pause_the_player.QuestionHTML: Complete the Button1.Click event handler so that it will pause the Player when the button is clicked.
Hints: You'll need the appropriate purple block from the Player drawer.

quiz_button_click_stop_player.Name: quiz_button_click_stop_player
quiz_button_click_stop_player.DisplayName: Event Handler: Button Click Stop Player
quiz_button_click_stop_player.Description: Stop the Player when the button is clicked.
quiz_button_click_stop_player.QuestionHTML: Put together all the blocks necessary to handle a button click event on Button1. When Button1 is clicked, the app should stop the Player component.
Hints: You'll need the Button.Click event handler in the Button drawer.
You'll need an appropriate purple block from the Player drawer.

quiz_pause_the_sound.Name: quiz_pause_the_sound
quiz_pause_the_sound.Description: Pause the sound when a button is clicked.
quiz_pause_the_sound.QuestionHTML: Complete the Button.Click event handler so that it will pause the Sound component when it is clicked.
Hints: The Sound component is similar to the Player component.
Look for an appropriate purple block in the Sound drawer.

quiz_button_click_stop_sound.Name: quiz_button_click_stop_sound
quiz_button_click_stop_sound.DisplayName: Event Handler: Button Click Stop Sound
quiz_button_click_stop_sound.Description: A button click event handler that stops the sound component.
quiz_button_click_stop_sound.QuestionHTML: Put together all the blocks necessary to handle a button click event on Button1. When Button1 is clicked, the app should stop the Sound component.
Hints: The Sound component is similar to the Player component.
You'll need the Button.Click event handler in the Button drawer.
You'll need an appropriate purple block from the Sound drawer.

quiz_quarts_to_gallons.Name: quiz_quarts_to_gallons
quiz_quarts_to_gallons.QuestionHTML: Define a function 'quartsToGallons(x)', with one parameter representing amount in quarts, that returns the amount in gallons, where 1 gal. = 4 qts.
Hints: Hint #1.

quiz_recursive_factorial.Name: quiz_recursive_factorial
quiz_recursive_factorial.QuestionHTML: Define a recursive function, factorial(n), that computes n!.
Hints: You will need the procedure-return block in the Procedures drawer.
Recursive definition: f(n) = 1 if n=0 otherwise f(n) = n * f(n-1)
With the current blocks, you will probably need to use a local-def-then-return block and a do-then-return block in the function return slot.
quiz_recursive_factorial.Xmlsolution: <xml><block type="procedures_defreturn" inline="false" x="5" y="-18"><mutation><arg name="n"></arg></mutation><title name="NAME">factorial</title><value name="RETURN"><block type="local_declaration_expression" inline="false"><mutation><localname name="name"></localname></mutation><title name="VAR0">result</title><value name="DECL0"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value><value name="RETURN"><block type="controls_do_then_return" inline="false"><statement name="STM"><block type="controls_if" inline="false"><mutation else="1"></mutation><value name="IF0"><block type="math_compare" inline="true"><title name="OP">EQ</title><value name="A"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">n</title></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">0</title></block></value></block></value><statement name="DO0"><block type="lexical_variable_set" inline="false"><title name="VAR">result</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">1</title></block></value></block></statement><statement name="ELSE"><block type="lexical_variable_set" inline="false"><title name="VAR">result</title><value name="VALUE"><block type="math_multiply" inline="true"><mutation items="2"></mutation><value name="NUM0"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">n</title></block></value><value name="NUM1"><block type="procedures_callreturn" inline="false"><mutation name="factorial"><arg name="n"></arg></mutation><title name="PROCNAME">factorial</title><value name="ARG0"><block type="math_subtract" inline="true"><value name="A"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">n</title></block></value><value name="B"><block type="math_number"><title name="NUM">1</title></block></value></block></value></block></value></block></value></block></statement></block></statement><value name="VALUE"><block type="lexical_variable_get"><title name="VAR">result</title></block></value></block></value></block></value></block></xml>
